title: Ciara slammed after she takes son to watch orcas perform | Daily Mail Online
text: 24 shares SeaWorld's San Diego theme park stopped doing their large Shamu Stadium shows this month. All SeaWorlds have since agreed to not breed the creatures, making those in captivity their last generation. Long been an issue: Almost as soon as she posed the video, hundreds of people flooded her Instagram with comments about the cruelty of forcing the animals to perform for the star's amusement, something SeaWorld has been criticised for The changes follow a public outcry about the treatment of the aquatic mammals fanned by documentary film Blackfish, which was released in 2013 and told the story of Tilikum. Tilikum - who died this month - was involved in three human deaths and was kept in isolation. Despite all this, the singer and her football star husband took her son Future for a private orca show. Not impressed: While some fans said nice things about the family outing, most were disgusted with the singer 'Get educated': Many told the star to 'watch Blackfish', while another even pointed out the comparisons between these animals' captive lives and slavery In the video, which Ciara caption 'Making Music and Dancing With The Whales', a whale trainer guides the trio as to how to get two whales to 'sing and dance'. Using different hand motions, the family encouraged the orcas to make sound and then move around including wobble their tales back and forth. One Instagram user wrote: 'This is disgusting. Has she ever watched the news? Does she not understand that not only is she glamorizing animal abuse, she's encouraging it. @ciara this is pathetic.' Despite thousands of comments, Ciara - who is expecting hers and Russell's first child together - did not remove the video or explain why she decided to attend the orca show. Sad story: SeaWorld has agreed to stop breeding captive orcas and its San Diego park has stopped doing stadium shows after a public outcry about the treatment of the aquatic mammals fanned by documentary film Blackfish, which was released in 2013 and told the story of Tilikum Share or comment on this article 24
